name: titles_and_names
train_text: Dr. Adams wrote a paper. Dr. Brown reviewed it. Mr. Lee met Ms. Kim in Jan. They discussed results.
text: Dr. Adams arrived yesterday. He presented the paper. Mr. Lee agreed.

name: country_abbreviation
train_text: The U.S. team won. The U.K. team lost. Prof. Liu wrote notes.
text: The U.S. market rose today. The U.K. market closed early.

name: time_abbreviation
train_text: He woke at 7 a.m. She slept at 9 p.m. They worked in shifts. The office opened at 8 a.m. The office closed at 6 p.m.
text: She arrived at 8 a.m. He left later.

name: initials_sequence
train_text: Mr. J. Smith arrived. Mr. K. Brown departed. The meeting ended.
text: Mr. J. Smith spoke first. Mr. K. Brown answered.

name: decimal_and_sentence
train_text: The value was 3.14 in tests. Another value was 2.71 in logs.
text: Revenue rose by 3.14 percent. Costs dropped by 1.5 percent.

name: quotes_and_closers
train_text: He said "go now." She replied "okay." They left quickly.
text: He said "we should go." Then they left.

name: parentheses_and_titles
train_text: Dr. Green (chair) opened the meeting. Prof. White closed it.
text: Dr. Green (chair) spoke first. Prof. White responded.

name: multi_sentence_starters
train_text: However the team stayed calm. Therefore they won. Meanwhile others waited.
text: However the report was late. Therefore we delayed shipping.
